title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1 Early Child Development (ECD)

description.narrative: Output 2.1. Early childhood development(ECD)By 2020, strengthened national capacity to coordinate, manage and scale up quality integrated early childhood care and development programmes, with a focus on the most deprived and vulnerable children., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2020, an effective and efficient well-resourced formal and non-formal quality education system that is inclusive, relevant and accessible to all boys and girls with increased school retention, completion and achievement rates.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1. Early childhood development(ECD)By 2020, strengthened national capacity to coordinate, manage and scale up qualityintegrated early childhood care and development programmes, with a focus on the most deprived and vulnerable children.

description.narrative: Encouraging progress was made in ECD systems strengthening and in empowering parents to support their young children. Since early 2020, the COVID-19 pandemic has forced ECD centres and schools to close, but ensuring continuity of early learning was not part of the priorities in the initial response. To fill this gap, UNICEF and partners developed and broadcasted interactive radio talk shows on ECD. The talk shows promoted responsive caregiving, reaching 43,888 parents (16,915 women) who became empowered and better placed to foster their young children’s growth and development, including providing social and emotional support in the COVID-19 context. | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/01/2021
